column5: I'm in the same boat with a lot of others where my annual fishing trip to Canada has been cancelled. Can this group offer some suggestions for a US alternative? Me and my fishing buddy are looking for a quiet walley retreat. Smaller lakes preferred over the Great Lakes. We're in the NE but are considering traveling as far as the Upper Peninsula if that's the best option this year. Thanks all!

Talked to my fishing partner tonight, and it's possible that we may be in that same boat as well.....................I'm wondering if somebody might be able to post some links to some DNR websites for Minnesota, Wisconsin, Michigan, etc, which would provide lake profiles, average depth, maximum depth, water clarity, gamefish and forage species, etc.In the event that we need to go with a backup plan and fish somewhere in the States, if somebody could post links to some of your favorite waterbody research sites, that would be appreciated.Looking for something similar to the "Fish ON Ontario" site.Thanks guys!
If it's walleyes that you're after try Dan's Resort in Pickford, Mi or Lake Gogebic in the western UP.
Jackpot sept n Oct should be a go,fishing is good then in Ontario,try to rebook if you can, good luck
I hope you are right on a September go date as I am flying out of Red Lake on the 11th. 100 days to go.

Is your outfitter open? My builder buddy in RL says its awfully quiet up there. Very little otters flying around, huge percentage of camps not open. The camp across from his house doesn't even have docks in the water.
Rich I'm praying it's a go in sept cause I'm suppose to be on the road sept 11 to Ontario,but I'm just an ant in the ant hill like everyone else just have to keep our fingers crossed
Anyone been here? Mostly interested in the wallet fishing.
I would like to catch some wallets also if I can find a good wallet lake lol
